snippet: Positive data on retail sales and jobless claims did not allay fears that tax increases and spending cuts, set to begin in 2013 if no deal is reached, will hurt growth.
abstract: Standard & Poor's 500-stock index declines, ending six-day winning streak as worries intensify that Washington’s fiscal negotiations are dragging on with little progress.
lead_paragraph: Positive data on retail sales and jobless claims did not allay fears that tax increases and spending cuts, set to begin in 2013 if no deal is reached, will hurt growth.

headline.seo: S.&P. Streak Comes to an End on Fiscal Worries
headline.main: S.&P. Streak Comes to an End on Fiscal Worries
headline.print_headline: S.&P. Streak Comes to an End on Fiscal Worries
